simpledc.dc:creator: Kendrick Lamar
simpledc.dc:title: To Pimp A Butterfly
simpledc.dc:description: The thrid studio album from Compton, California-born rapper Kendrick Lamar. This album was the anticipated follow-up to his 2012 "Good Kid, M.A.A.D. City." "To Pimp A Butterfly" was critically lauded, winning album of the year for 2015 from reputable outlets such as Rolling Stone, Billboard and Pitchfork. Considered both timely and enlightening, the album discusses a number of personal and societal issues Lamar was interested in, such as African-American culture, race and racism in the United States, institutionalized racism, and survivors guilt. The album was certified platinum in 2016, and won 4 Grammy awards.
simpledc.dc:subject: Hip Hop
Rap
African-American culture
Race in the United States
Institutionalized racism
